definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: Now, Mr. Martin is on the 10 floor. The attendant comes to meet Mr. Matin.
sentences.chinese: 马丁先生到了十楼，服务员走过来迎接他。

sentences.english: Qin Shan people, with great mind, are stretch out their arms greeting friends from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 秦山人以博大胸怀，张开双臂迎接世界朋友的到来。

sentences.english: The band played the guests in.
After we greeted, we went to play basketball in Liwan Gymnasium.
sentences.chinese: 在我们迎接，我们去荔湾体育馆打篮球。

sentences.english: The stakes are higher, people are restless, poised for even greater transformation.
sentences.chinese: 人们正马不停蹄地准备迎接更大的变革。

sentences.english: Chinese Ambassador to Russia Li Hui also greeted Hu at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 中国驻俄罗斯大使李辉也到机场迎接。

sentences.english: On arriving at the station, he found his wife waiting to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 他一到达车站，立即发现他的妻子在等着迎接他。

sentences.english: in the New Year. We wish the merriest of Christmas to you and your loved
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节转眼又到，又该迎接新的一年了。

sentences.english: Lilac Wine, I feel unready for my love.
sentences.chinese: 丁香酒，我仍未准备好迎接爱情。

sentences.english: China's cities and provinces are gearing up for the country's first national tourism day.
sentences.chinese: 国内各省市都在紧锣密鼓的迎接首届国家旅游日。

sentences.english: The astronaut was welcomed with joyous,resounding acclaim.
sentences.chinese: 人们欢声雷动地迎接那位宇航员。

sentences.english: They turned and ran towards him as he came trotting to meet them.
sentences.chinese: 她们转身向熊跑去，熊也小跑着来迎接她俩。

sentences.english: My house has smartened up for the Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我家已装饰一新以迎接圣诞节。

sentences.english: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
sentences.chinese: 彼得一进去，哥尼流就迎接他，俯伏在他脚前拜他。

sentences.english: Walk in the sun, do not forget preparing for the dark.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光下行走，勿忘准备迎接黑暗。

sentences.english: This final meeting wrapped up the iteration and set us for the next day.
sentences.chinese: 这个最后的会议结束了这个迭代，迎接下一天的开始。

definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
